=3D 'If I Recall Correctly'.

> % ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/arcreader --help
>=
 usage: java org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader [--digest=3Dtrue|false] \
>      =
       [--format=3Dcdx|cdxfile|dump|gzipdump|header|nohead] 
> [--offset=3D=
#] \
>             [--strict] [--parse] ARC_FILE|ARC_URL
>  -d,--digest    =
Pass true|false. Expensive. Default: true (SHA-1).
>  -f,--format    Output=
 options: 'cdx', 
cdxfile', 'dump', 'gzipdump','or
>                 'nohea=
d'. Default: 'cdx'.
>  -h,--help      Prints this message and exits.
>  -o,=
--offset    Outputs record at this offset into file.
>  -p,--parse     Pars=
e headers.
>  -s,--strict    Strict mode. Fails parse if incorrectly format=
ted 
file.
> 
> The 'nohead' argument on the 'format' option is what I was =

referring to 
> in my last mail.
> 
> Study how the 'nohead' is implemente=
d inside in ARCReader.
> 
> To get body of a record at a specific offset:
>=
 
> % ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/arcreader --format=3Dnohead --offset=3D122333388=

> 
> (Where 122333388 is some arbitrary offset into an ARC).
> 
> IIRC (sm=
ile), the above was a bit buggy but basically worked.
> 
> St.Ack
>
